info.name: Spinal cord, ventral column or funiculus
info.description: The ventral columns or funiculi of the spinal cord are AKA the anterior columns or funiculi of spinal cord. They are the part of the white matter of the spinal cord that extends from the ventral (or anterior) median fissure to the ventral lateral sulcus, i.e. the point of exit of the ventral roots from the spinal cord. Present bilaterally, it contains several tracts, most of which originate at higher levels of the neuraxis. However, part of the clinically important spinothalamic tract is located in this funiculus.
